abstract: One of the two men fired by Dow Chemical on Thursday has rejected allegations that he held unauthorized talks with potential buyers of the company. “The behavior of the company is very unusual, and the accusations have absolutely no substance and are highly damaging to my reputation after 30 years of employment,” Romeo Kreinberg told The Associated Press. Mr. Kreinberg, who had been an executive vice president at Dow, was dismissed Thursday along with Pedro Reinhard, a member of Dow’s board, for holding what the company said were “highly inappropriate” talks with third parties about a possible sale of Dow Chemical.
